name: Nitrogen Network
mission: Equip urban churches and communities to holistically flourish.
vision: Transform underserved neighborhoods by empowering leaders, strengthening well-being, and closing the technology gap.
core_values: Holistic Care: Integrating spiritual support, mental health resources, and practical technology.
Human-Centered: Designing culturally sensitive, accessible programs.
Ethical AI: Keeping the human in the loop and promoting responsible innovation.
Equity & Inclusion: Building local capacity to ensure lasting community transformation.

key_programs.name: Pastors Thriving Together
key_programs.description: A six-month leadership journey pairing urban pastors with experienced mentors in Michigan, Charlotte, and Atlanta.
components: Training in resource management, fundraising, and community collaboration
key_programs.outcome: Sustainable, multiplying ministries led by connected, well-equipped pastors.

key_programs.name: Mental Health and the Church
key_programs.description: In partnership with Restored Counseling Group, training church leaders to recognize, refer, and support mental health needs.
key_programs.outcome: Churches serve as trusted, culturally sensitive hubs for compassionate community care.

key_programs.name: AI, The Church, and Urban Communities
key_programs.description: Hands-on AI skills training to close the digital divide and spur local innovation.

tracks.name: Youth
tracks.outcome: Designed an AI-integrated app addressing a local challenge.

tracks.name: Community Adults
tracks.outcome: Personal AI action plan and a functional community-oriented AI app.

tracks.name: Business Leaders
focus: Apply the MOST framework to strategy
tracks.outcome: Working AI tool or roadmap enhancing organizational operations.

key_programs.name: Urban Church Planting
key_programs.description: A five-step process to launch and sustain new urban congregations.
key_programs.outcome: 35 churches launched in Michigan; 45 more planned by 2028 in Atlanta and Charlotte.

proven_impact: After-school programs, food pantries, and job-skills workshops that boost community engagement.
Digital-literacy gains leading to new career pathways.
Strong peer networks reducing pastoral isolation and increasing ministry sustainability.
strategic_goals: Pastors Thriving Together: 100 pastors trained by 2026.
Mental Health & the Church: Launch in 20 new congregations yearly.
AI in the City: Train 500 participants annually across all three audiences.
Urban Church Planting: Plant 10 new churches per year through local partnerships.
